user-authorized-key.description: SSH public key in order to connect to the SSH server of this runner instance

instance-amount.description: number of slappart to deploy inside the runner. Needs instance to be restarted.

slapos-software.description: a relative path from the slapos git repo to a folder containing a software release, which will be automaticaly deployed while the runner instanciation, and only if the parameter auto-deploy is set to 'true'. For example: 'software/helloworld

auto-deploy.description: authorizes the software declared with 'slapos-software' to be automatically deployed, or not. Needs instance to be restarted.

slapos-repository.description: url of the default git repository that will be download by the runner while its instanciation. Will be cloned in a directory named 'slapos'

slapos-reference.description: commit reference on which the default repository will checkout

auto-deploy-instance.description: prevent the runner from deploying and starting instances. Needs instance to be restarted.
auto-deploy-instance.default: true, but is set to false for instances of type 'import' in resiliency

autorun.description: let automaticaly build and run a declared software with 'slapos-software'. Only works if 'slapos-software' is set, and 'auto-deploy' is true. Needs instance to be restarted.

slapos-software-type.description: Software type of your instance inside the runner

parameter-*.description: '*' is a parameter which will be used to configure the instance inside the runner.

custom-frontend-backend-url.description: return an ipv4 frontend of the given ipv6(+optional port)

custom-frontend-backend-type.description: The type of the frontend slave instance to ask

custom-frontend-basic-auth.description: if the ip given with 'custom-frontend-backend-url' is secure, set it to true for the promise do not fail

custom-frontend-instance-guid.description: Instance guid of the frontend you whish to use

custom-frontend-software-type.description: SoftwareType of the frontend you request

custom-frontend-software-url.description: Software Url of the frontend you request

monitor-port.description: allow to manually change the port on wich the apache server running monitoring interface is listening. The default value for the webrunner is different from the default value of the standalone stack-monitor server

resilient-clone-number.description: is the number of clones to be deployed when a resilient runner is ordered. Its value can be 1 or 2
